content.description: Fully traverse the left-most stack of the three-stack pillar as seen from the beach looking to the ocean. Start and finish in the archway. If your feet go more than four feet off the ground, you’re too high. Climb in a counter-clockwise direction.
content.protection: Pad or spotter if desired. Spotter is really all that’s necessary since you’re not high off the ground.
content.location: The three-pillar stack just on your right as you walk down the main path. This is the closest stack to the path. The rock quality is surprisingly good and is the best on the beach.

content.description: Fully traverse the three-pillared stack that is the closest stack on your right as you come down the main path to the beach. Go in a counter-clockwise direction. The rock quality is surprisingly great.
content.protection: Pad and spotter if desired. Spotter is probably the only one necessary.
content.location: The three-pillared stack closest to the main trail.
